Tris Prior.Action: Expresses hesitation and panic about choosing her faction, showing vulnerability.
Shares a quiet moment with family and friend before testing, attempting to acknowledge their presence.
Opens and closes her mouth several times, wanting to speak but not following through.
Panics and pleads when forced to quickly choose a faction in a high-pressure situation.
Wakes up on testing day calmly and methodically prepares by dressing simply and leaving her room purposefully.
Struggles to find words to respond to brother's encouragement but manages to say thanks.
Thanks brother Caleb before he walks away.
Wants to say more to Caleb but refrains.
Asks Tori why she has a hawk tattoo, showing curiosity.
Feels ashamed immediately after asking about the tattoo and does not insist further.
Trusts Tori enough to drink unknown liquid despite questioning what it is.
Thanks brother Caleb politely after his reassurance.
Wants to say more to Caleb but does not speak, hesitating.
Sits gracelessly in the chair, showing some lack of confidence or comfort.
Asks a curious question about the hawk tattoo despite cultural norms, showing intelligence and inquisitiveness.
Opens her mouth to respond to Tori but closes it again without speaking.
Drinks the unknown liquid from the vial when told to trust Tori.
Stays absolutely still and bows to the snarling dog, then proceeds to stroke it when accepted.
Hurts her body to pin the dog to protect the girl dressed in white.
Does not reveal information about the brutal murderer despite pressure and intimidation from the man on the bus.
Responds to aggressive accusations with calm denials rather than escalating conflict.
Stays absolutely still and bows to the aggressive dog, successfully calming it and gaining its acceptance.
Pounces on the dog to protect the girl when the dog attacks.
Relaxes a little and scowls when prompted to choose but questions the command instead of blindly obeying.
Shows signs of recognition and fear when seeing the newspaper headline, but ultimately lies under pressure to protect herself.
Appears visibly shaken and shakenly denies knowledge of the murderer despite aggressive interrogation.
Lies to the man on the bus about knowing him to protect herself.
Throws herself at the dog in selflessness to protect the girl.
Displays ability to deceive man on the bus with dishonesty to avoid revealing true nature.
Demonstrates complex decision-making and selflessness by throwing herself at the dog to protect the girl.
Is puzzled and confused by the contradictory test results and the meaning of Divergence.
Nods in response to Tori's serious warning and hesitantly leaves after being advised to choose wisely and keep her decision secret.
Thanks her father sincerely before the Choosing Ceremony.
Nods in understanding after Tori’s serious instructions despite initial confusion.
Hesitantly leaves after the tense encounter with Tori, showing some uncertainty but respects the gravity of the situation.
Stands hesitantly and shivers slightly when drawing blood to choose her faction, showing vulnerability.
Leaves the podium after deciding, showing tension when seeing her father’s accusing eyes but also recognition of her mother’s supportive smile.
Hesitates and appears indecisive while choosing her faction, dropping blood almost onto the floor.
Despite hesitation and visible tension, she ultimately chooses a faction, demonstrating the ability to decide under pressure.
Hesitantly jumps off a seven-story ledge despite fear and uncertainty, demonstrating courage and commitment.
Tris chooses to identify herself sincerely when asked her name.
Jumps last off a 7-story ledge into a dark hole with no visible safety net, despite hesitation and fear.
Hesitates before jumping but then executes the jump successfully and recovers shakily, demonstrating courage and skill.
Takes time to consider and then confidently states her chosen name 'Tris' when prompted by Four.
Observes initiates thoughtfully and notices differences in uniforms attentively.
Silent during Four's warnings, does not show fear or judgement.
Looks around the crowd and counts the number of initiates left.
Wears an Abnegation uniform that stands out amongst other factions, showing self-awareness of difference.
Observes the environment and surroundings within the Pit calmly.
Accepts Christina’s handshake and introduces herself warmly.
Giggles and rolls her eyes in response to Christina's comment about leaving Abnegation because of food.
Shows curiosity and slight amusement when Christina asks about hamburgers, indicating openness and friendly demeanor.
Accepts Christina's handshake confidently and introduces herself without hesitation.
Reacts with slight amusement and curiosity when learning what a hamburger is, showing openness to new experiences.
Seems shocked by the initiation schedule and concept of free time, indicating unfamiliarity with new environment but attentive.
Stares pensively at the ceiling and quietly wipes away tears without drawing attention to herself
Lies awake pensive and tearful but quickly composes herself, dabbing tears from her eyes and snapping out of a daze.
Tris looks pensive and tears up quietly when another initiate, Al, cries.
Tris quietly practices fighting techniques diligently and seriously, showing focus and resilience.
Tries kick #1 again but punching bag barely moves, shows persistence.
Forgets to breathe and tenses when FOUR touches her stomach, indicating nervousness.
Responds thoughtfully when describing Four as 'intimidating' showing self-awareness.
Responds to social introduction to Al politely and confidently shakes his hand.
Looks bewildered at the idea of tattoos, indicating unfamiliarity or hesitation with unfamiliar social practices.
Refuses to conform to social expectations by defending her decision not to change her hair or piercings.
Passively allows Christina to drag her around and change her appearance despite initial protests.
Shows curiosity and openness by asking what is wrong with her clothes instead of ignoring criticism.
Expresses feeling different but refrains from negative judgment about herself or others, showing vulnerability about never having looked at her reflection for so long.
Approaches Tori and suggests they should talk sometime, showing trust and willingness to connect.
Respectfully accepts Tori's hesitation and changes topic to tattoos, showing tolerance and adaptability.
Recognizes the importance and risk of talking to Tori in private, and initiates a whispered conversation despite potential danger.
Chooses a tattoo symbolically representing her new life and her family she left behind, showing thoughtful decision-making.
Appears hesitant and awkward when commenting on her new look in the mirror, indicating a lack of confidence in self-perception.
Follows Christina when she changes the subject, showing some social flexibility and ability to adapt.
Seems relieved when topic changes, suggesting discomfort in prolonged self-reflection.
Intensely focuses on the fight between Christina and Molly, carefully observing the situation.
Remains a bystander during the violent fight without intervening.
Does not show immediate physical or verbal reaction to Christina being assaulted repeatedly, indicating possible inexperience or uncertainty.
Confronts Peter despite her injuries, stands up for herself with calm danger.
Listens to Al and Christina’s supportive words but remains wary.
Shows concern by asking Al about Will’s well-being.
Smiles at Al’s self-deprecating humor, indicating friendly rapport.
Despite being injured and bruised, she quickly advances on Peter to confront him.
Shows cautiousness by wincing due to injuries but does not let it stop her from confronting a bully.
Expresses doubt and unconvinced by Al's advice to ignore Peter, indicating mindful consideration rather than blind trust.
Does not escalate conflict further when faced with Peter’s taunts and leaves after he departs.
Refuses to fake losing to avoid fighting Molly, determined not to become factionless.
Shows anger and murderous look in response to Molly's taunt.
Determines to not lose again after a previous loss and expresses clear motivation to avoid becoming factionless.
Walks shakily to the arena, indicating nervousness and lack of confidence.
Ducks and counters Molly’s attack quickly and aggressively with punches and evades grabs, showing adaptive fighting skills.
Fails to cause significant impact to Molly as punches do not produce strong reactions, suggesting limited effectiveness in attack.
Blocks Molly's punch with forearms, demonstrating defensive capability.
Ruthlessly attacks Molly after being provoked and does not stop despite Molly's whispered plea to stop.
Responds with anger and rejection when mocked and humiliated by Peter, Molly, and Drew in dormitory.
Attempts to leave the scene when harassed but is physically violated when Peter yanks off her towel, revealing her nakedness.
Punches Molly again while struggling against Four's restraining arms.
Dodges Molly's sloppy kick and quickly counters by driving her elbow into Molly's face, demonstrating agility and offensive capability.
Rushes forward and attacks Molly repeatedly, showing aggression but also controlled and effective fighting skills.
Continues to beat Molly despite her pleas, revealing emotional motivation overpowering tactical restraint.
Freezes at the dormitory door and fumbles to get dressed when confronted by Peter, Molly, and Drew, showing insecurity and lack of confidence in a social situation.
Attempts to run away when harassed and embarrassed but is caught off guard and exposed, indicating vulnerability and lack of situational control.
Punches Molly again in the training room while struggling against Four’s arms, demonstrating persistence and courage under physical constraint.
Runs to her mother, embraces her with tears.
Glares at Four after being told to leave.
Walks away insisting she is fine despite internal doubt.
Relaxes after winning, but glares at Four showing controlled confidence.
Insists she is fine despite emotional struggle, showing self-reassurance and mental resilience.
Scans the crowd to find her mother, demonstrating alertness and awareness.
Runs to hug her mother and openly shows emotion, indicating emotional expressiveness but also vulnerability.
Tris shows concern about her father not visiting and tries to understand the situation by saying, 'You can tell me if he didn’t want to come.'
Tris introduces Four to her mother modestly, calling him 'just one of my instructors' despite his intimidating presence.
Defends her mother fiercely when insulted by Cara, threatens physical violence to protect her family.
Shows intolerance and aggression toward Cara by threatening to break her nose and demanding silence.
Expresses certainty in her beliefs and determination to prove others wrong.
Defends her mother forcefully, threatens to break Cara's nose, and shows determination to prove others wrong about Jeanine and the government.
Displays anger and aggression in response to criticism, which may cloud her judgment or escalate conflict unnecessarily.
Admits she is ranked close to the bottom and shows shame.
Hesitantly shares that her aptitude results were inconclusive, despite apparent pressure to withhold information.
Admits she is ranked close to the bottom in the Dauntless initiation.
Hesitates and struggles to disclose her inconclusive aptitude test results.
Shows willingness to listen and absorb her mother’s warnings about being careful and staying in the middle during initiation.
Expresses surprise and asks questions about what is going on, demonstrating curiosity and awareness.
Insists on understanding the reason before acting on her mother's request, showing a desire for clarity and honesty.
Expresses disregard for how others perceive her when it comes to obeying her mother's wishes.
Stands with friends to see the rankings, maintaining composure amidst Molly's outrage.
Receives a supportive hug from Will, responds positively to friendly gesture.
Ranks 6th among her peers after the first round of fights, indicating solid performance and skill relative to others.
Reacts calmly and confidently to being ranked below others like Molly, who is outraged and confrontational.
Kneels next to injured Edward, soothes him and encourages him to breathe despite the pain.
Calms and reassures Edward despite his pain, instructing him correctly to wait for a doctor to remove the knife.
Expresses anxiety about whether she was good enough.
